page.title: 17Churches,Ayot St.Lawrence
page.content: {THE OLD CHURCH, }dedicated to St. Lawrence, a Christian martyr, whose heart,after his death,is said to have been roasted on a grill in "Ayot Manor",dates back to the 12thC. When Sir Lyonel Lyde became Lord of the Manor and built a new house,he decided to pull down the church as it spoilt the view from his house.Everyone was cross so Sir Lyonel had to stop.Now the Ames family own it.It is in a dangerous condition, so the gate is kept padlocked. {THE NEW CHURCH,}built by Sir Lyonel to look like a Greek Theatre, from his house, has, on each side, a pavilion; under one is Sir Lyonel's tomb and under the other is his wife's. He is supposed to have said that the church made him live with his wife, but he was not going to be near her when he was dead!
